bibl.author: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman
bibl.title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 5 May 1868
bibl.orgName: The Trent Collection of Whitmaniana, Duke University Rare Book, Manuscript, and Special Collections Library

revisionDesc.change: encoded final t as unclear in haven't; added word chicago and choice encoding; removed comma after 'how he feels'
Proofreading Corrections: Heyde dates and Silent Proof
Added date annotation and proofreading corrections, updated notes
corrected date format in title; added call no., annotations

body.p: it seemed quite a treat to get your letter you are the only correspondente correspondent i have at present they seem to all dropped off i havent haven't had a letter from Matty in a very long while except a few lines from Jeff from cincinnatta Cincinnati i havent haven't had any word from him since his arrival home he promised he would write as soon as he arrived i told him if he was busy when he got back for mattyMatty to write because i wanted to hear but i have not got any if they have wrote to me i have not got it i think maybee maybe they have and it has been taken and han too she promised in her letter she would never

be so long again without writing but i suppose they all have enoughf enough to doo do without writing when one gets out of the way of writing its hard to get in it again mattyMatty was going to write to me so often she said before shee she went away she would write every week i got the papers to day with the letter walterWalter i like the chicagoChicago news very much i never saw one before i wish whenever you have one you would send it to me
well walterWalter dear we have leved lived to see another may day May Day come and gone not as much moving as usual they say in the papers many has broke up houskeeping housekeeping on the account of rents being so high i have been to look at several places georgeGeorge wants to get out of this place very much i went yesterday to look at one in carlton aven Carlton Avenue just out of fultonFulton but it was no better nor any more room than we have here
and 10 doll dollars more rent a month i would rather live here than there and all the places i have been to see was something that would make it disagreable disagreeable in some way or other) here i can doo do just as i like but of course there is some disagreable disagreeable things but they are all as clever to me as they can beebe) georgeGeorge has lots of fun about their calling me lady whitmanWhitman the family that has come in up stairs has five children but i think she is very clean woman and the children seems orderly but they have to run up and down so there is some noise i told georgeGeorge yesterday i wasent wasn't going any where to look at any more houses but was going to wait for something to turn up i am quite lame in one of my knees i dont don't know what makes it so it pains me considerable i suppose it
must be the rheumatism settled there) sometimes i can hardly walk and then it will be better to day it feels quite bad on account perhaps of the appearance of a storm)

i suppose the impeachment is draging dragging to a close georgeGeorge thinks Bingams Bingham's speech is splendid just his sentiments exactly he said at dinner time) i havent haven't read it yet their speeches is so long i hope this will not be so lengthy as the others poor old man i wonder how he feels it will be rather sad if he is convicted for all i suppose he hasent hasn't done right i see in the papers if he leaves he will be esscorted escorted through the cityscities) walterWalter you must have congratulations from all quarters poor old alcotAlcott he must be very old seems to me) you remember waltWalt that sunday Sunday morning we couldent couldn't have him)

postscript.p: mrMr. Lane told georgeGeorge they had raised Jeffs Jeff's salary to 6000 but i think it must be a mistake
